pageContext.claim: “In San Diego, they were begging us to build a wall, because it was being overrun -- a certain section, wealthy section. But it was being overrun by illegal immigrants pouring into the neighborhoods -- and dangerous. And they were -- you have no idea. They were begging us. … As soon as it was built, they said, ‘We don't want the wall.’ By the way, all of their problems went away. They actually did want the wall.”
pageContext.analysis: San Diego does not support construction of the wall and it is not being constructed there. The Republican mayor of San Diego has said, "We already have a safe and secure border in San Diego built by the federal government." The city council passed a resolution opposing the border wall.
